I have noticed a slight reduction in Anxiety and Depression but not much improvement with migraines. Will continue at this dose for a while to see if it improves. This medication is worth trying_ side effects are much milder than many other medications I have been on. Start low_ work up slow! A low dose may be all you need. Feel free to e-mail me at mikefred a.t. gmail d0t com.

Side Effects: Dry mouth- severe constipation_ orthostatic hypotension_ fast heartbeat
Comments: Constipation I experienced was severe_ laxatives didn't work. Bowel movements became painful and bloody. Developed a fissure.Also_ experienced terrible withdrawal while coming off (nausea_ vivid/terrifying dreams/ insomnia_ hallucinations_ and emotional disturbances)

Side Effects: Was taking 20 mg before bed;no side effects but still getting migraines. Dr. increased it to 50 mg. Been on it 2 weeks and no migraines but terrible taste in my mouth_ dry mouth and weight gain...Going to drop back down to 20 mg

In the first week I experienced dry mouth and severe constipation (I required prune juice and Coloxyl with Senna to address five days of no movement). This reoccurred after a dose increase but isn't significant any more. I do experience weird dizzy sensations (I feel like I'm falling even if I'm sitting down) occasionally but they're not a result of standing too quickly_ so I'm not sure of their cause. They're not severe though; just a little unsettling. I take my dose at 9pm each night and when I go to bed at 11pm_ I don't feel sedated at all. I have not experienced any sexual side effects. An antidepressant that works without sexual side effects...Wahoo!
Comments: I've tried Zoloft_ Aurorix_ Avanza_ Efexor_ Pristiq and Cymbalta. Of those_ only Efexor was effective_ but it lost its effectiveness. My doctor advised that nortriptyline is the only of the secondary amines available in Australia_ so I decided to try it. I took 25mg the first night_ then 50mg for a week and have been on 75mg nightly since. Unlike with Efexor_ my emotions aren't blunted; I just feel like I'm in a natural good mood most of the time. I still feel emotions strongly when appropriate_ but I don't feel down for no reason and my energy/motivation has improved. I don't sleep as well as I did on Efexor_ but I don't feel tired during the day. To think I avoided the tricyclics all these years and the first one I try is effective with fewer side effects. Don't rule them out - nothing compares to their efficacy for major depression.

Side Effects: Dry mouth and constipation
Comments: As a teenager I was on this medication for a few years and I seem to recall that it worked quite well.  My doctor was a little hesitant to prescribe this since it's considered an 'old school' anti-depressant; however_I've never been able to tolerate the SSRIs or SNRIs so she finally agreed to let me try it again.  So far so good.  I've had few side effects and I'm nowhere near as anxious as I was before.  I do find that it works better when I take the full 50mg at bedtime otherwise I'm drowsy in the a.m.  This is a welcome relief from the SSRIs which made me feel wired but tired all the time.

Side Effects: Weight gain...have gained 25 pounds in 10 years
Comments: I can not take SSRI meds_ and this has always worked for me. Tried both Celexa and Zoloft and they both made me very very anxious....so went back to PamelorHave been on and off this medication for about 20 years

Side Effects: Weight loss.  10 lbs in 3 weeks.  Some dizzyness.  Loss of appetite. Really tired and lightheaded during the day or activities.  Heart racing.
Comments: I started out on May 21_ taking 10mg for 5 days. Then 20mg for another 5 days. Now_ since June 1_ 30mg.

Side Effects: Taking 2 capsule at bedtime_ helps me sleep(was having trouble sleeping)_but sleeping through out the day_waking up til 3pm.Im very sleepy/tried/groogy through out the day.
Comments: Have had less headaches-migraines_ 1-3 a week now. Use to wake up with headache and later that evening would have another headache_ DAILY for months

Side Effects: I'm taking this medication at night 10mg 2x for my severe migraines_ it's the 3rd medicaiton I've tried and it's worked great! In the beginning I had dry mouth but that went away in a few weeks. The only side effect I continue to have is having trouble sleeping. There are nights where I don't fall asleep till the middle of the night and have to wake up for work by 6. This medication has helped my migraines by 95% I normally would have one everyday and now I have one maybe once a week sometimes I don't have them at all. It's a great medication if you can get past the side effects. But I would take the trouble sleeping over having horrible migraines anyday! Yes_ weight gain is another side effect.

anxiety acted up after the first few days taking it. heart beat racing. blood presure up. i had anxiety attacks almost everyday. they checked my heart to see if there was any problems with it and there was nothing wrong with it all they could figure out was that it was this medicine that was making my anxiety and heart rate act up so bad.

I was on 100 mg a day.  I did experience weight gain.  I had severe thirst and dry throat to the point of choking and have developed a habit of carrying around a route 44 from sonic all the time. (which didn't help the weight gain) Also_ very sensitive to heat and my head would sweat under my hair.
Comments: Pamelor would knock me out when I first started taking it.  Even five years later_ I slept very deeply and had a hard time waking up in the morning.  If I had to be up super early for some reason_ I had to skip the previous night's dose or take it in the late afternoon or I'd never wake up early enough.  I have stopped taking it over the last six weeks or so.  It did help so much with my anxiety and panic disorder.  I would recommend it despite all of the side effects to someone with that diagnosis.

Side Effects: gained 20 pounds in a month or two.I am 21 years old 5'11 and have weighed 160 for years. When I started Pamelor about 6 months back it was fine. in the past months I have not been able to sleep at night due to extreme heat flashes_ wierd dreams_ shouting in my sleep. None of these symptoms occurred before the medication. I reached 180 pounds randomly in a few months. I cannot perform during the day at work due to drowsiness. I quit cold turkey about a weak ago and already lost 7 pounds_ although I feel like im schizophrenic now cause I hear things in my head and am always dizzy. weird stuff. my doctor has been increasding my dosage but my blood tests reflect that the amount of nortryptiline in my blood is decreasing. How do you figure. No wonder they dont perscribe this stuff anymore_ it does more harm than good!

My wife insisted I write this....she was on 150 mg of Pamelor for her migraines_ which it did help a lot (why we gave it a rating of "4").     However_ she gained 70 lbs in like a year!!   Craved carbs....we had to lock up the cabinets at night....and BTW_ my wife never had a weight problem.    She went off of the drug and within about two weeks was able to take off about 6 lbs.     The Pamelor "cured" the migraines_ but then caused serious weight gain and her feeling very depressed and badly about herself.   She is now off of the drug_ as noted above_ and now refers to the drug as "evil."

Knocks me out cold for hours- so i take it at night_ which helps since i also have insomnia. I find that sleeping is the best medicine for Migraines_ so i take Pamilar to help me sleep longer so when i wake up my migraine is gone. No side affects besides Prolonged drowsyness to the extreme!
Comments: I've been taking it for about 8yrs_ no complaints except i still get migraines up to 4 days a week so i don't think its helping much besides making me sleep good!

Side Effects: drowsiness_ very bad_ violent nightmares
Comments: It helps my headaches_ but I get a bad nightmare about once a month due to the medicine. Also_ night terrors- but that may not be due to Pamelor

Side Effects: first 5 weeks: motion sensitivity_ vomit taste in mouth_ bad heart burn_ loss of appetite/weight (10lbs/4wks)_ increased hostility_ started questioning the point.
Comments: even at 10mg did seem to help with the vestibular migraine butafter 5 weeks side effects suddenly went away and so did any benefit.

Side Effects: Weight gain..7 pounds in four weeks.  Very dry mouth occasionally.
Comments: I take 25mg at night. Sleep great.  Feel better.  The weight gain is a concern but I hope it levels off soon.  I use this to augment Prozac.  I've been on Prozac for 12 years.

Side Effects: Increased appetite_ weight gain even though I watched my diet and exercised almost daily_ dry mouth/throat.
Comments: I orginally thought that my migraines decreased in severity and frequency when I first started the drug_ but now 3 months after being off the drug_ I am still doing as well as I was when on the meds. I was only on 50 mg at the highest.

made me feel horrible.  I felt depressed and anxious on it.  Just wasn't right for me.

I started Pamelor because SSRI drugs make me worse_ so now I am "on" exercise_ meditation_ counseling only.
none
weight gain_ increased appetite_ constipation

Side Effects: vivid dreams and a little dry mouth_ drowsiness and strange taste in mouth went away after a couple of weeks
Comments: It took about 1 week to get into my system and since then I haven't had a migraine in 3 weeks. This is amazing as I was getting 2-3 a week. I'm so happy and hope it continues!

Side Effects: Am currently taking 3200 mgs neurontin daily (800 mgs x 4) with one 50 mg dose of Nortriptyline nightly.  Expected to increase these amounts to 3600 mgs daily of Neurontin & 75 mgs nightly of Nortriptyline...  The side effects are:  very drowsy during the day (don't drive). Easily confused. Dry mouth.  Often feel jittery (like too much coffee).  A lack of sex-drive (not good !)
Comments: Because Nortriptyline is taken in conjunction with a regime of Neurontin it is difficult to distinquish which med is causing which effect.  The combination of medications has been a godsend in regard to pain levels (pain is less debilitating but far from "gone") and will continue to take both as prescribed by Doctor until it is no longer effective.  I had started with lowest dose of each and steadily increased as "break-through pain" escalated.  Will have to take a wait and see approach for the time being.

Side Effects: Dry mouth_ fast heart rate_ sleepiness_ spaciness_ some jitters_ constipation_ trouble concentrating and trouble with word retrieval_ fatigue and weakness esp. in legs_ LOTS of sweating and hot flashes_ mildly increased anxiety (compared to Trazodone treatment)_ possibly some weight gain or bloating_ shallow breathing/difficulty breathing - can't tell if that's from rapid heart rate or asthma kicking in.
Comments: I took Trazodone for fibromyalgia for 13 years but wanted a change because it wasn't doing enough for pain and because of suspected weight gain.  Pamelor made noticeable improvement in my pain_ but I'm not sure I can tolerate the side effects_ which are many_ and which get in the way of my work.  Still_ I've tolerated it better than several other drugs I've tried.

Side Effects: Dry mouth_ blurred vision_ constipation_ weight gain (15 pounds in 6 months)
Comments: I am a professional ballet dancer and had to stop dancing due to the amount of weight I was gaining.  Within two weeks of stopping this pill I lost 10 pounds.

Side Effects: None

I have tried Amitriptyline in the past but could not tolerate it_ Topamax_ Propranolol and Cymbalta did not help_ not to mention natural therapies and botox. Too soon to know for sure_ but I think it's really helping! My nerve pain (mystery upper molar pain) is still present but at a lower level which does not stop me from functioning now. I don't even take Motrin for it anymore. Anxiety... too low of a dosage to really help I think but I have been feeling pretty good!

Side Effects: weight gain_ dry mouth_ rapid heart beat_ trouble urinating_ constipation_ tiredness
Comments: I still get migraines almost everyday but they are nothing like they were before. I am now able to live a happy productive life. It significantly decreased the severity. I gained about ten pounds but I am taking 150 mg_ which is a pretty high dosage.

Side Effects: None
Comments: I have been taking Pamelor for the last 3 years after trying numerous other drugs for migraines.  Immediate relief_ however you have to get the proper dosage right.  I started at 25mg and went to 50mg.

Side Effects: None
Comments: Went from 11 migraines monthly to 2 the next month_ after starting Pamelor. The next month had none! Taking 25mg at bedtime. Started out at 10mg nightly for 2 weeks_ then 20mg nightly for 2 weeks_ then  25mg nightly. Have had only a few headaches since starting this med.

Side Effects: extreme drowsiness/fatigue_ overheating_ more headaches_ too tired to function
Comments: Wouldn't recommend taking nortriptylin... On a considerably cool day_ I always felt as if it were burning up. The migraines went away at first_ but even when my dosage was doubled_ they still came back.

It doesn't make me fall asleep_ but makes me sleep deeper when I do sleep.  I have lots of "busy" dreams_ but can't remember them in the morning.  We'll see if it really stopped the migraine or just gave me side effects that mimic migraine symptoms (dizziness_ blurred vision_ nausea).

Side Effects: I was told it would also help me sleep but it didnt. I just read that it can cause sensitivity to sun and skin rash_ and I have had severe breaking out with red spots all over_ & Dr. said was a conbination of medication reaction & allergy to sun_ wish I had know this a year ago. I am stopping it now.

In these trhee years I gained 60 pounds. I was atlethic_ swimmer. I worry about my health with this weight.

Side Effects: Fatigue/Sleepiness! (not at night)  Slight weight gain-5 lbs. in 2 weeks.  Huge cravings for carbs/sweets.  Did I say overwhelming sleepiness?
Comments: Started on 25 mg at bedtime 2 weeks ago.  Told my doctor today that the daytime drowsiness was too much to tolerate.  Ambien-10mg still not enough_ but will seek other answers.  Have tried lunesta before.

Side Effects: Weight gain_ dry mouth_ mild light-headedness_NIGHT TERRORS_craving of sweets.
Comments: I've tried many other anti-depressants over the years and nothing has worked until I tried Pamelor- truly a life saver. Was non-functionable until taking this drug_ and now my life is fairly normal. I will take the side-affects any day over the way I was feeling prior. Worst side-effect by far is Night Terrors_ but not sure if linked to Pamelor or withdrawals from Klonopin that I had an addiction to a year or so ago. Feel energetic and very "UP" at 100 mg nightly.

Side Effects: dry mouth_ blurry vision_ weight gain_ craving for sweets_ constipation_ difficulty swallowing at higher doses_ hair loss(?)
Comments: Initially_ I thought the drug was working to alleviate my migraines_ but the number of migraines I ended up getting monthly ultimately seemed to be about the same as before the medication (dose went from 10 mg up to 75 mg).  I am pre-menopausal and my migraines seem to come and go depending on my hormones which come and go!  I am now gradually lowering the Pamelor and am finding that the drug seemed to "blunt" my emotive state.  I am feeling different now that I am down to about 20 mg_ in a good way.  Now if I could just get through to the other side of menopause!

Side Effects: Became extremely suicidal.
Comments: Depression worsened and I didn't realize.  I became extremly suicidal on this medication.  Wanted to run my van into a tree.  Did not help with pain or depression.

Side Effects: Weight Gain; Hair Loss; Overheating/sweating
Comments: Only only taking 20mg_ but have not observed any discernable improvement in my migraines.  I would be willing to keep trying by increasing the dosage if I wasn't so scared of these side effects.  I'm not sure that being a fat_ bald woman is a good trade-off for being rid of migraines.  To be fair_ I went off of Topamax which made me lose weight_on to Depakote for a few months and then to Nortriptyline...so I can't say how much of the 20lb weight gain is attributed to the Nortrip.  But the hair loss has to be from the Nortrip and it is getting out of control.

Side Effects: weight gain_ dry mouth_ constipation
Comments: I have trigeminal neuralgia_ migraines_ and depression. I wasn't quite sure why I was having such dry mouth attacks_ but chocked them up to high sugar (I'm diabetic). When I checked my sugars and they were fine_ I remembered I was taking a new medication and took a look here and found that Pamelor had to be the reason. Now I see that it's probably the reason for my sudden weight gain and constipation. I can't seem to drink enough water to quench my thirst_ but the thirst isn't really anywhere but in my mouth_ so drinking isn't actually the remedy anyway. I've been on medication that caused weight gain and I don't want to go down that road again. I've given those clothes away. I'm currently on 50 mg and will be going to 75 mg next week. Not sure what to do if I keep gaining.

Side Effects: HUGE weight gain_ always tired_ I'd go from awake to nearly asleep within 30 minutes of taking it.  I couldn't handle the weight gain and have lost 6 pounds in 3 days since stopping it.
Insomnia (only on 10mgs_ hope this changes when I go to 20 mgs)dry mouth
Comments: So far so good but I also take with xanax

Side Effects: At first: flippy heart_ hypotension_ dizziness_ dry mouth_ constipation. Agitation and sleeplessness the first night. Now only dry mouth. No weight gain. I was worried about that. I now crave apples and Honey Bunches of Oats. I eat many bowls of Honey Bunches of Oats per day. But I've actually lost weight. So if you get sugar cravings_ grab a bowl of cereal and skim milk.
Comments: I've been on A LOT of meds to help treat my anxiety. SSRI's and Benzos don't agree with me and I wasn't sure what else to take. This worked. It took just a few weeks. Maybe 3-4 to feel a change. Probably 8 weeks to feel considerably better. A few months ago I thought my life was over. Now I can feel calm. I can feel joy. I can feel excited. I like it. I just feel like me.

Side Effects: SWEATING AND REFLUX
Comments: CHRONIC PAIN FROM NEUROLOGICAL DISEASES_ PAIN IS STILL PRESENT BUT AT A LOWER LEVEL

Comments: This is the first thing to help my migraine headaches. My headaches were so severe I couldn't go a day without vomiting from them and could barely function. Now I never have to vomit from a headache. I still get daily headaches but they are at a much more tolerable level and I can function again. This medicine has caused weight gain and I have only been taking it three weeks. It also has started to relieve my depression so this medicine is worth the weight gain.

Side Effects: head rush when getting up too quickly (my low blood pressure contributes to this as well)_ slight weight loss_ loss of sex drive and painfully dry penis.
Comments: Despite the side-effects this drug has definitely eased my depression. I was suicidal before taking it_ but am now managing ok. I take 75mg per day. On the few occassions I've not taken it I have found it impossible to sleep.

Side Effects: Side effects were far fewer and less severe than other drugs I've tried such as: Effexor_ Zyprexa_ and Lamictal.  The only minor side effect was the blurred vision that only started after I reached the 100mg dose.  Also have infrequent but noted "lightheaded" feeling sometimes upon standing too quickly.
Comments: This has been the first drug (out of 10+ I've tried over the course of 5+ years of depression treatment) that's actually worked and helped me in an ongoing and positive way.  I'm very pleased with the outcome.

Side Effects: Just started taking it_ but major heartburn and waking up about 4am (sleep really good till then)
Comments: Really hope this works....tried like 12 antidepressants and couldn't handle any of them!!!  Guess this is last resort.  Also am on klonopin or xanax (switch up sometimes)

Comments: I have been waking up with horrible migraines for a year and a half and I have tried beta blockers and topamax which didn't help at all and these are the first days I have woken up without horrible migraines. I just started it so the migraine was still present but I was able to function so much better for the first time. The only problem is it triggered hypomania but I have suspected for sometime that I might have bipolar disorder

Side Effects: constipation_ "head rush" when standing up_ drowsiness.
Comments: Took this for about 2 months.  Started at 25 mg which made me a zombie the first two days.  Then moved up to 50 mg and later 75 mg.  Did not help with my depression or anxiety.  I took this for 2 months and it made me constantly drowsy.  I also "saw stars" from time-to-time and had to get out of my chair slowly due to the blood pressure changes.  Also_ major constipation.  I'd rather be depressed!

Side Effects: Night sweats_ crave carbs and sweets_ weight gain_ hair loss_ VERY deep sleep_ difficult to wake in the morning_ foggy until about noon. ( I take 25 mgs after dinner to try to have it worn off by morning.) My "official" diagnosis is:  Intractable Chronic Daily Migraine and Moderate Myofacial Pain.
Comments: I have been taking this for 1 year. I am happy to say that I rarely wake with disabling head pain in the night-comes on during the day instead!  Am taking lots of meds. so it's hard to know what side effect is directly linked to Pamelor.

Side Effects: Ringing in ears (especially at night) but tolerable_ increased appetite (especially for sweets) and about 15 lb. weight gain_ rapid heart rate and extreme sweating at night and with activity.
Comments: Even with the noted side effects_ Pamelor is a life saver.  I was put on Zoloft which made me worse and very freaky feeling.  I felt better after taking only one 25 mg Pamelor.  I am currently taking 50 mg once every night.  It's wonderful stuff!!

Side Effects: Slightly elevated heart rate
Comments: When my body was first adjusting to the medication I gained some weight_ had major carb cravings and felt sort of emotionless_ but now_ I don't have side affects and the cravings I use to have are under control. Ive even lost 30 pounds as a result of WW. I have a slightly elevated heart rate_ but that could also be due to the fact that I am anemic

Side Effects: Weight gain_ constipation_ dry mouth_ dizziness_ difficult urination
Comments: Pamelor helped with insomnia.  I take 10mg at night_ and it has really helped me sleep at night.  Most of the side-effects are annoying_ but are tolerable.  I cannot deal with the weight gain_ though.  Five years ago_ I lost 50 pounds_ and over the past eight months on Pamelor_ I have gained 30 pounds back.  I am going to have to talk with my doctor about trying something different.

Side Effects: Dry mouth_ constipation_ & weight gain(over 50 lbs)
Comments: THis has saved my life!  I started it about 12 years ago and even though the side effects are bothersome_ they are nothing compared to the benefits of this medicine.  I am on 50 mg 2x a day.  I felt like my old self again. I definitely recommend this.  It is also very affordable considering it is an older tryclics.  I've tried a lot of the newer SSRI's but all had bad side effects.  I really struggled with my weight gain_ but it gave me my life back_ so there was really no choice.

Side Effects: None
Comments: Incredibly pamelor not only reduced amount of headaches from almost everyday to 3 or 4 times per month_ it also regulated my period (which i had been consulting a gynecologist for) as well as brought relief to a sun enduced skin alergy_ regulated my sleep and helped me feel better overall in the mornings.

Side Effects: inability to urinate_ dry mouth_ dry eyes
Weight gain (20lbs)_ major sweet tooth_ crave carbs_ sleepiness after taking dose (take in the evenings)_ dry mouth_ constipation_ arrhythmias.
Comments: I tried about 10-12 different antidepressants and none of them worked for me. Pamelor was the only drug that had any positive effect on my depression. When I am depressed_ I stop sleeping and eating. With Pamelor_ I am able to sleep and eat normally again. And that makes all the difference for me. I am a migraine sufferer and Pamelor has not eliminated my migraine attacks. Perhaps it does for others_ but for me_ they continue to occur regardless of being on the highest possible dose of Nortriptyline.

Side Effects: Fatigue_ fast heart rate_ nausea_ dizziness_ chestpain_ and difficulty concentrating.
Comments: For about half a year now I've been getting steadily more frequent and more intense migranes. I've tried almost every kind of medication for it. While most of the others simply didn't work this one actually made me feel worse. Not only did I get all the side effects_ but my migranes have persisted as well. And I take it at bedtime to try to make me sleep_ but it only makes me tired the following day it seems. It's been difficult to move around much for the last day; I have almost zero energy.

Side Effects: I'm on Skelaxin_ Ativan_ Pamelor_ Oxycotin(long lasting one) and Dilaudid so I don't know which one causes what BUT I have dry mouth_ sweating_ craving for sweets and gained 10 lbs in 1 week. Seems to correlate with others description of side effects of Pamelor
Comments: I was told it's used for 'chronic pain' and hopefully I'll be off of it soon.

Side Effects: Dry mouth_ other than that none.
Comments: Pamelor has worked great for me at 25mg x 4 daily_ best TCA in my opinion.

Side Effects: tiredness_ vomiting_ ringing in ears at first.  Nightmares start and then subside with each increase in dosage_ along with constipation and weight loss due to decreased appetite.  Sometimes_ the appetite loss runs for weeks at a time.

I'll need to ask my doctor just how many mg's of this stuff I can take on per day before having to switch or add meds.

Side Effects: trouble thinking_ concentrating_ amotivation
Comments: When I first started taking Pamelor 25mg at bedtime_ I was also on Topamax_ so I attributed most of my cognitive trouble to the Topamax. Now that I am off Topamax_ I am still having some trouble connecting the dots_ and sometimes the wrong word comes out of my mouth when I mean something else. I also have a hard time staying on task.  Like others on this site_ I crave sweets_ and am starting to gain back the wt. I lost on Topamax. It is a great sleep aid_ my migraines are better (also taking verapamil) and no hangover in the morning. I'd like to get down to 10mg at bedtime and see if it reduces the side effects but still helps sleep and keeps the headaches at bay.

Reason: Aid for Sleep/ Muscle Pain-10MG day
Side Effects: Weight Gain-in a year of taking it I gained weight_ it will not budge no matter what I do. If_ in fact_ its the Pamelor. Don't know if I can attribute this to the Pamelor or not.
Constipation_ solved by eating high fiber diet including Metamucil; craving for sweets_ just eat fruit to counter that.
Comments: I started taking nortriptyline over a year ago for chronic pain and the subsequent depression I experience dealing with it.  It does help me sleep a little better at night and I have managed to not gain any weight while taking it (I think this is related to my high fiber diet_ since I can hardly exercise at all due to nerve pain and chronic tendinitis. I'm skinny but with zero muscle tone_ strange because before all this I was in great shape).  I've realized lately that the nortriptyline really hasn't helped the depression or the pain for that matter_ and even though I tried upping my dose from 10 mg to 25 mg_ all it did was make me incredibly drowsy.  Looks like I'm going to be in the market shortly for another form of antidepressant_ especially since chronic pain and depression have such viselike grips on one another.

Side Effects: Felt a little zoned out in the morning but that side effect stopped after a week or two.  I've been taking 10mg once a day for 15 years.
Comments: This has been a miracle drug for me with the panic attacks.  I've tryed Prosac_ Zoloft and Paxil.  Had very severe side affects from all of them.  I have been almost panic attack free for 15 years.

Side Effects: Carbohydrate cravings and 15 pound weight gain.

I gained 60 pounds in 2 months and we later found out that my metabolism was working at a very minimum level.  I haven't gained weight since I stopped taking the meds and got my thyroid working again but I haven't yet been able to loose the weight and it has been 2 years.  If I had continued taking it for much longer I would be in severe trouble.

Side Effects: constipation_ weight gain_ drowsiness and sluggishness throughout the next day_ mental fog
Comments: At first this was amazing for me.  I quickly went from migraines 50% of the time to migraines only 10% of the time.  The weight gain has been unpleasant_ but I took out an old photo of my great-great grandmother_ and reminded myself that middle aged women are *supposed* to look a bit roly-poly.  .  .  Anyway_ after the nortryptilan working really well for 18 months or so_ my migraines have returned to their original frequency_ and are becomeing more intense_ as well.  So_ maybe I am developing a tolerance for it?  Maybe I should up the dose?     I am concerned about increased constipation_ which is uncomfortable and unhealthy.  Usually I take about 300mg of stool softener (docusate sodium) every day_ and that has helped to keep me regular.

Side Effects: Possibly permanent vision changes_ compulsive nibbling
Comments: Prior to starting Pamelor had vision checked by an ophthalmologist (eye Dr.) Got blurry vision about a week after starting Pamelor 25mg. It didn't go away_ so had vision rechecked. It had definitely changed. I talked with my psychiatrist who took me off Pamelor and put me on Prozac which is not known to cause eye problems. Today_ 6 weeks after discontinuing the Pamelor_ my vision has improved compared to being on the drug_ but is still blurry and according to the eye doc has not improved to what it was before starting the drug. So I need to put out $150 for new glasses.

Side Effects: Dry mouth
Comments: I am being myself again; I am energetic_ active_ making plans_ taking care of my body.

Side Effects: Tremors/ shaking (especially in hands)_ dry mouth_ zoned out_ jittery_ slower responses.
Comments: Started off on 25mg along with 2mg of Lunesta. The first week I took it I felt majorly zoned out. Also had bad tremors during the day. These got a little better after 2 weeks. Eventually increased to 50mg a day at 2 weeks_ then 75mg at 4 weeks. I'm sleeping much better but I'm still having issues with shaking and zoning out. The zoning comes and goes_ but on bad days I feel like when I'm speaking with people_ I have a hard time forming a sentence. Now at 6 weeks_ I'm going to try reducing to 50mg per my doctors instructions. If the shaking and zoning issues continue I'm going to go off of it.

Side Effects: I started at 5 mg (splitting the 10mg capsule) and increased to the entire pill after a week.  I have mitral valve prolapse_ and after the increase it was definitely exacerbating the heart palpitations.  I had to step up very slowly.  I also noticed a little bit of drowsiness_ dizziness_ dry mouth and constipation_ but they were all pretty minor and easy to deal with.
Comments: Helped with the pain and was also very helpful for depression and anxiety/panic.  Generic version makes it inexpensive.  I'm taking 20mg now and thinking of trying to up it to 25 since I think some of the symptoms may be returning.

Side Effects: (not taking this drug as an anti-depressant)It has helped chronic pain situation. I am calmer_ but a bit thick headed. Need more sleep per night_ and I'm hungry more often. Maybe a few very mild hallucinations_ like seeing something out of the corner of my eye that wasn't right- but that isn't bad.. :)
weight gain_ drowsiness_ tiredness
Comments: I acquired TMJ from a motorcycle accident and at this time have a nasty_ nauseating 24-7 migraine unless I take the Pamelor.  It has made me feel fairly normal again_ but if I exert myself physically and try to lose the bloat and weight it causes_ the headaches return.  I'd like something stronger that doesn't bloat so I can return to an active lifestyle.

Side Effects: major weight gain..gained almost 50 pounds in a year-  my original neurologist did not warn me about this-  new doc is taking me off and switching me to Topamax-  I have a big frame_ but 50 extra pounds has turned out to be very problematic.
Comments: has reduced the migraines somewhat_ but also noticed that I seem to have developed a bit of a tolarance to it_ as migraines has increased slightly after about 18 months.  Was taking 100 mg a day- didn't notice tiredness_ but did continue with insomnia problems.  I read one other user that thought that getting off Pamelor and just dealing with migraine meds was the way to go_ I guess I agree- hoping Topamax performs as advertised...

Side Effects: dizziness_ drowsiness during the day_ some insomnia_ constipation (rectal bleeding)_ nausea (when taken on an empty stomach)_excessive sweating_ heart palpitations_ and increased heart rate.
Comments: I take for Pamelor to help me sleep at night.  Sometimes it works_ sometimes it doesn't. If I take it when I'm not tired at night_ it tends to keep me awake. It seems to work best when I am already tired. It makes me really sluggish during the day also. You're supposed to stay out of the sun while taking this medication_ but it's kind of hard for me to do since I'm in college.  It increases my sweating_ and makes me feel dizzy when I move around too much.  Not the medication I would recommend if you're on the go as much as I am.

Side Effects: I was a little drowsy the following am after my nightly dose of 10 mg.  That was for only the first couple mornings. I didn't have any other side effects.
Comments: I had been taking 40mg of Prozac_ and I was having breakthrough panic attacks and my anxiety was getting worse by the day.  Tried Wellbutrin_ but was too stimulating for me to continue on.  Now I'm on 10mg of Pamelor along with my Prozac_ and I'm getting relief.  It has only been 1 week _ and I can really tell the difference .  I'm starting to feel like myself again.  I do have the option to raise the Pamelor to 20mg_ but for now I'll stay at 10mg as long as it is helping.  I would recommend trying Pamelor....it honestly has saved me.

Side Effects: slight constipation
Comments: helps me sleep much better - get a good night's rest.

Side Effects: Very dry mouth resulting in some dental problems but to me_ worth it. Also_ made me very sleepy at first after I took it_ not so much now after several years_ take at night anyway.
Comments: Tried Paxil & Wellbutrin for extreme anxiety and panic attacks.  Both quit working after 6 weeks or so. Have been taking pamelor for over three years_ take 100 mg every night. Started at 50mg_ after a year or so had to increase to 100mg. This drug has changed my life_ I can control the anxiety and panic attacks that had taken all quality of life away. Also_ very cheap since it is an older tricyclic drug.

Side Effects: Constipation (treated successfully with Metamucil)_ increased hunger and some weight gain.
Comments: For me_ this seems like a really good drug.  I tried Lexapro 10 mg. for about 10 days.  Horrible sexual side-effects.  Enough to make me stop taking it.  Now I'm on only 10 mg. Pamelor once daily.  I lost about 55 lbs. over the last 3 years through diet and excersize_ so my Dr. wanted to use the lowest effective dosage.  Well_ it works!  My attitude turned around after a week_ my focus is great and my 5 + years of depression and insomnia are coming uder control.  A bit tougher falling asleep_ but I am abnle to stay asleep -- which was my problam.  Still get some anxiety when under especially stressful situations (I have a high-stress job)_ but I'm also armed with Xanax "just in case".  Down side is that my appetite has increased and I put on about 5 lbs.  This has happened before during holidays and vacations_ and I have been able to get it off again.  I'm planning on stepping up my workouts and trying to bring the hunger under control.  Would hate to have to get off this.

Side Effects: dry mouth_ dehydration_ severe constapation that caused rectal bleeding_ weight gain_ mild agitation
Comments: It prevented my migraine headaches. I have experienced only some dizziness_ which I usually experience before the migraine headache starts.

Side Effects: Weight gain_ carb cravings_ constipation_ tireness_ heartburn (if taken on empty stomach)_ some sexual fixation
Comments: Best of the antidepressants that I have tried_ but weight gain is difficult to cope with.  Carb cravings are uncontrollable.  50mg was the minimally effective dose.  I tired to lower it to 25mg to control weight gain_ but the anti-depressant effect was lost.

Side Effects: Constipation_ weight gain_ dullness_ "jerking" at night_ laughing in my sleep (really!)
Comments: In spite of the side effects_ I think Pamelor is one of the best meds out there--it helped pull me out of overwhelming anxiety/depression with relatively mild side effects. I like the fact that it (or at least a pharmaceutical "close relative") has been on the market for decades_ so we assume it doesn't suddenly produce bizarre or dangerous long-term effects.  Also_ it (or the generic) doesn't add financial stress to the patient's already-stress-filled life. Furthermore_ it doesn't seem to kill off the libido like so many of my friends report the SSRI drugs like Prozac and Paxil can do. While not a euphoria-inducing "cure-all_" it helped me cope_ sleep_ return to life.

Side Effects: Weight gain of 20 lbs. and climbing after 6 months on 50mg dose daily.  Craving for carbohydrates_ in particular chocolate. Constipation.  Dullness of mood.  Dizziness upon standing from sitting position.
Comments: The worst thing about it was the weight gain and craving for chocolate_ cereal with whole milk_ Ben & Jerry's icecream...But even worse_ the stomach aches after eating and dizziness upon standing up from sitting or lying down.  I passed out cold twice_ the most recent being the night before last.  I'm bruised in places from my chin to my hand and ribcage_ due to how I landed.  Totally unconsciousness.  Came back around vomiting and extremely disoriented.  I'm not broken_ so could have been worse.  Dr. says to discontinue the Pamelor by taking half-the-dose for 3 days_ then every other day_ then stop.  I can't wait to see the difference in how I'll feel.  This drug was definately not for me!

Side Effects: weight gain is a major problem
Comments: I took 10mg/day for almost a year with little results but 4 mos ago my doc upped my dosage to 25mg/day and i've had only two migraines since so I am definitely a believer now.  However_ my doc did not warn me about the weight gain just recently.  I've gained almost 20 lbs in 4mos!!  If I can't make it stop I'll probably just stop taking it and deal with the expensive migraine meds again.

Side Effects: (first week only) really ZONED OUT and tired(fell asleep easily during day); constipation (also passed); at first night sleep was very light with many dreams (this has passed for the most part_ as well).  Now I sleep well_ with no noticable side effects.  Perhaps made me a little impulsive emotionally (easy to cry and angry???- this passed too)
Comments: Dr. started me at 10mg.  Did not not work_ did not sleep well at all (racing mind with too many dreams).  Dr. suggested doubling dose. Did not want to go back on it because I did not like the zoned out feeling was worried what 20mg would do.  Out of desperation I did it (20mg) and  the Zoned out period only lasted one week.  Does not drug you up or knock you out  for the night like ambien or Terazapan.   It simply helps you fall back asleep if you are awaken in the night.  Does not stop ringing in ear_ but helps me not notice it as much (seems more distant).  Have been on it one month and am still sleeping great_ no longer zoned out at all.  No weight gain or food cravings at all at this dose.

Side Effects: started w/50mgs. Made me very sleepy (still does). I was surprised to get some pain relief in shoulders & leg. No relief for back pain. It wears off quicker now & I don't get the same relief. Tried doing 100mg & it was too much! It's the first med I've had for fibro that has worked. ssri's have not worked for me.

Can not sleep.  Makes my body tense.  I just started about 1 week ago at 25mg.  Can't sleep.  I want to switch to taking it during the day_ but must check with Doc since warning label says do not take during day if you normally take at night.
Comments: So far_ it has helped my headaches.  I'd say about 80% effective.  I get headaches after reading too much.  It only takes 30 minutes of reading for me to get horrible headache that lasts for days.

Side Effects: dry mouth_ shakiness in limbs and instability_ mild anxiety
Tiredness - mostly overcome with time.
Comments: Now trying to withdraw from several years of taking 25 mg/day and the withdrawal symptoms are hard to live with.  GI disturbances_ gas_ chronic gut noises_ headache_ restlessness.  You are supposed to slowly decrease the dosage_ but when you are taking the minimum and the drug is in capsule form there is no way to go but cold turkey.

Side Effects: dry mouth_ heart palpitations_ constipation_ carb craving_ nightmares (now decreasing)
Comments: Finally I have found some relief of my SEVERE anxiety after numerous failed trials w/newer antidepressants (SSRIs). Seems to be helping my depression_ less mood swings. My daily headaches decreased to minimal.

Side Effects: Severe dizziness and lightheadedness_ nausea_ stomach ache_ abdominal cramps_ constipation_ loss of appetite_ aggravated my tachycardia (I have SVT)_ drowsiness during the day_ insomnia during the night_ muddled thoughts_ difficulty concentrating
Comments: This medicine did not decrease my migraines at all_ and the only effect it had on my depression was causing my moods to seem more stabilized - stabilized at depression.  I took 50mg per day_ I tried taking it in the morning and the evening_ and splitting up the dose_ it still caused me severe drowsiness (I was practically a narcoleptic) during the day_ and inability to sleep at night.  I would not recommend taking this medication if you have SVT and are not on a medication to treat it.

Side Effects: continuous weight gain; first several days/weeks:spaced-out and trouble concentrating; some constipation
Comments: Success with Pamelor in general_ but over this past year have had to increase my dosage twice. It seems to wear-off after some amount of time and I keep having to add pills to my dosage. I am now taking 4 pills at bedtime and have begun having fairly perpetual migraines again (a bit less intense then pre-Pamelor_ though) and would like to try a new medication.  Also_ the weight-gain hasn't stopped and that is very frustrating for me.

Side Effects: extreme constipation_ less frequent urination
Comments: taking 40mg/day; worked fairly well for migraines_ and less frequent urination was actually beneficial for me.  The constipation was miserable_ and did not seem to improve even with more roughage in my diet

Side Effects: none.  makes me get a good night's sleep
CAUSES TIREDNESS IN EVENING
Comments: BEST ANTIDEPRESSANT ON THE  MARKET

Side Effects: weight gain_  if i take it at bed time it keeps me awake for several hours then it drains my body for the next day_  so i take it mid afternoon_ take 20 mg daily_ headaches have  decreased from everyday to 1 slight headache about every 5-6 weeks. very satisfied with decrease in headaches not happy with weight gain
Dry mouth_ some constipation
Comments: Supposed to be quite sedating.  Did nothing for insomnia or pain.  I think it helped mood a little bit (since it is a tricyclic antidepressant)_ but had side effects.  Gave up on it.

Side Effects: constipation_ dry mouth_ dizziness_ fainting_ feel tired all the time
Comments: hasn't worked yet I've been on it for a year and take 75mg a night

Side Effects: dry mouth
@ 25 MG daily_ very sleepy_ zoned out. Just wanted to sit and stare off into space.
Comments: Be VERY careful when you first start taking the drug.  Makes you very proned to falling asleep.  Gradually diminished as my body got used to the drug.

Side Effects: Mostly constipation and mouth dryness with bad taste.A few occasions of dizziness when standing up.
Comments: At 50 mg was improving my mood a bit_ but didn't like side effects_ and got no sedation whatsoever to help with sleep.Apparently these tricyclic type antidepressants help sleep for many people.  Not me.  Am getting off it.

Side Effects: stomach ache_ constipation_ insomnia
Comments: decreased from daily headaches to about 2 per week (25mg) and decreasing with higher dosage (35mg) - However_ stomach aches are becoming painful after meals with higher dosage.

Side Effects: Daytime sleepiness_ sweet tooth_ craving carbohydrates
Comments: At 50mg I was sleeping great_ but also tired all day and needed a 3 hour nap every afternoon.  Now on 20mg and it only helps a little with nightime sleep_ but not as drowsy during the day.

Side Effects: none
Comments: nothing except maybe even kept me awake at 10mg dosage. Sposed to help me sleep. Am supposed to up dosage to 20mg at night after three days at 10mg. Kinda afraid to though because it seems to wire me out like coffee.

Side Effects: Weight gain_ increased appitite_ need to sleep_ dry-mouth
Comments: It helped a lot as the dose increased_ but the side-effects are getting troublesome: mainly weight gain and increased appitite.
